alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 11 at 1:45AM MDT until October 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY BETWEEN 11 AM AND 7 PM FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, NORTHEAST PLAINS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A Pacific storm system will bring strong westerly winds through northern and central NM that will peak in intensity Thursday afternoon. Combined with low humidity below fifteen percent, strong winds gusting to between 45 and 60 mph will be capable of rapidly spreading any new ignition source. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (104), Northeast Highlands (123), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (124), Central Highlands (125), and East Central Plains (126) from late morning Thursday through early evening Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to west-northwest winds strengthening to 30 to 40 mph with gusts of 45 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
